newsitem.title: UK: LCE white sugar slides on Oct expiry, NY options.
newsitem.headline: LCE white sugar slides on Oct expiry, NY options.

text.p: White sugar futures added to their earlier weakness after the New York opening on Friday as the spot October contract tumbled in the little time remaining before expiry, traders said.
October slid over $8 to a session low of $338.00, producing a contango on the nearby spread which then bounced back as the second-month December contract firmed slightly off its same-value low.

Traders said the sudden weakness in the New York market, where October options are set to expire, had pushed the London market to even lower levels in the afternoon. "It's basis the weakness in October and the weakness in New York which is pulling it down," one trader said.
At 1601 GMT the October whites contract was still at $338.00, down $8.30 on the day. December was down $3.90 at $339.00 and most other positions were some $3.00 weaker.
Market sources said they expected only a couple of cargoes to be delivered against October, with Poland and possibly south Brazil as origins.

"The days of the squeeze look like they're over for the time being," the trader said, adding that the March contract was attracting the same amount of rolling October interest as second-month December.
"December is a quiet month on the whites so if people are rolling you'll probably get a fair share of that into March," he said.
Paris positions were also weaker ahead of the Matif October expiry in a volume of 1,913 lots.
October was down $2.00 at $341.00 and December down $4.00 at $338.50.
